node.title: Austin won't exempt Oklahoma National Guard from vaccine mandate
node.description: Austin said all members of the Defense Department's service branches must comply with the vaccine order or jeopardize their service.
node.content: ["Defense Secretary Lloyd Austin on Monday denied a request by the Oklahoma governor to exempt members of the state's National Guard from the Defense Department's vaccine mandate.\u00a0", "Austin told Oklahoma Governor Kevin Stitt that all members of the Defense Department's service branches must comply with the vaccine order or jeopardize their service. \u00a0", "In a letter to Stitt, according to a copy obtained by CBS News, Austin said, \"To maintain a healthy and ready military force capable of protecting the American people, the immediate vaccination against COVID-19 is an essential military readiness requirement for all components and units of the military, including the Oklahoma National Guard.\"\u00a0", "Pentagon spokesman John Kirby on Monday said, \"By not taking the vaccine, therefore not meeting a mandatory readiness requirement, an individual in the National Guard could put in jeopardy their ability to continue to serve in the National Guard.\"", "The Pentagon has not received similar requests from other states, Kirby said.\u00a0", "Guard members who refuse to take the vaccine could miss drill and training opportunities, which could result in the potential decertification of their skill sets and risk their eligibility to serve in the Guard.\u00a0", "The deadline for members of the Army National Guard to be fully vaccinated is June 30, 2022,\u00a0 while members of the Air National Guard face a deadline in a few days, on December 2.\u00a0", "According to the Oklahoma National Guard, about 40% of the Oklahoma Army National Guard are fully vaccinated and 89% of the Oklahoma Air National Guard are fully vaccinated.\u00a0", "Earlier this month, Stitt appointed a new adjutant general who said troops would not be required to be vaccinated. However, the Pentagon stated that the vaccine mandate applies to all service members, and individuals who don't comply risk repercussions.\u00a0", "The fight over this seems likely to continue. On Tuesday, \u00a0a spokesperson for Stitt told CBS News in a statement: \u00a0\"Governor Stitt appreciates that Secretary Austin responded to his letter and maintains his position that the governor is the commander-in-chief for all members of the Oklahoma National Guard while they are on Title 32 status.\"\u00a0", "CBS News reporter covering the Pentagon."]
